result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Caputo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs.  Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Caputo

Application for Jail Time Credit form

Defendant Thomas Caputo in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bond remains. Minutes Filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant Thomas Caputo in court with attorney Adam Johnson for  Jeffrey L Hahn.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.

Defendant Thomas Caputo in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Caputo in court with attorney Jeffrey L Hahn.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by attorney Johnson denied.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Caputo in court, in custody with attorney Adam Johnson for Jeffrey L Hahn.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Caputo appeared with Adam Johnson specially, Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
